description:
Make the Geoposition helper struct public

This CL moves the Geoposition struct from content/common to public/content/common.h so that it can be shared by content and browser. The struct is placed in the |content| namespace and as required by the style guide, all methods except the constructor and Validate() are removed.
This paves the way for a follow-up CL in which the content will provide geolocation information to the browser.

BUG=chromium-os:18710
TEST=Chrome and tests build, run

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=134989

messages.text:
Hi John,

As discussed, I broke my changes into several CLs. This first one moves the geolocation.h header to make it public.

few comments
-now that this is public, content/public/browser/geolocation.h should use it
-we're strict in the Content API about following the Google style guide, which this class doesn't. some of the issues are that it's a struct with methods (disallowed), and that methods that are implemented in the cc file have unix_hacker() names. if these methods are only called in one place, then perhaps take them out. otherwise this needs to be turned into a class.

it's better if you can keep this a struct, because we don't keep concrete classes in content/public, so you'll have to have an interface and an implementation in content/browser
Hi John, I addressed your comments. The Geolocation struct should not only contain methods explicitly allowed by the style guide now. Could you have another look?

lgtm with one comment

http://codereview.chromium.org/10316007/diff/4001/content/public/common/geoposition.h
File content/public/common/geoposition.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10316007/diff/4001/content/public/common/geoposition.h#newcode1
content/public/common/geoposition.h:1: // Copyright (c) 2012 The Chromium Authors. All rights reserved.
for this and the cc file, please "svn mv" them and not just copy them yourself and "svn add" them, so that we maintain the svn history.
